channel.title: Poems
channel.description: Stimulating poetry with photography specifically chosen to establish distinct imagery Go Pro // iPhone 5s // Ocean // Nature Sandy Beach // Makapuu // Ala Moana // Hawaii

item.title: Sky
item.description:
People claim they see Heaven on Earth
In some of the most beautiful and extravagant places
In reality heaven is right before our eyes
Some days heaven is a mystery,
A shroud of wispy clouds are strewn across endless blue
The sky protects our naivety and shields us from dangers,
Like the warm protective wings of a mother bird
but it also brings about a strong curiosity in mankind
Everyone wants to see what utopia lays beyond the sheath of blue
Or brilliant blanket of stars
But somedays I’m content right where I am,
Gazing across the horizon I’m in my own heaven on earth
Why ask for more?

item.title: Destruction (Perfection Part 2)
item.description:
The quivering lip bubbles above the face of the wave
It is ready to leap and crash onto the sifting water,

As frail as the lip of the wave looks,
The might and strength of the ocean trails not far behind it
The wave’s graceful approach is followed by a violent eruption
A calm before the storm,
But before the wave breaks and crumbles
A brief glance of its unique beauty and perfection is allowed.
As brief as the moment was, the wave collides with the water below it
Upon impact the wave shatters like glass,
Beauty reduced to nothing in a matter of a split second
Like a gorgeous clay structure smashed into a meaningless blob,
The roar of millions of tons of water plowing into each other
Reverberates deep into the ocean depths,
The explosion is accompanied by a gentle spray of cool crisp mist.

This is Yin and Yang
the correlation of dualities
The Yin, gentle and assiduous creation of a perfect wave
Followed by the Yang, violent and belligerent destruction of a wave
No good comes of their opposition,
But only in harmony together
can the two coexist.

item.title: Perfection
item.description:
They say a beautiful thing
isn’t perfect...

The quivering lip bubbles above the face of the wave
It is ready to leap and crash onto the sifting water
Then, time seems to halt
As if God himself takes a moment to admire his creation
Its crevices and curves,
The textures of sands and shells trapped in its walls,
Shades of rich deep blue gently faded into playful sea green,
And finally, a web of pure white sea foam woven carefully on the surface.

Each wave is unique, just like a snowflake
The possibilities are limitless
And there can be no right or wrong
Undeniably,
waves are both beautiful and perfect

item.title: Bloom
item.description:
A diminutive flower bud stunted by the elements Violent gusts rattle it’s stem, and fearsome tremors threaten its roots tucked and braced for bitter survival Storms thunder above the now withered flower Dust fills every crevice and crease Its petals slowly crinkle and turn brown
When all hope seems lost for the frail flower A gentle shower eases its struggle Sunshine grants nutrients and energy The damp soil slowly, but surely nurtures the flower
And finally glistening beads of morning dew perch themselves,
Upon the pristine petals of a fully bloomed flower.

item.title: Contrast
item.description:
As the wave approaches,
It slowly swells to a menacing size.
It’s deep blue mass slides dangerously.
I paddle towards it, and my heart pumps violently.
The icy water ripples through my fingers.
Looking into the intimidating blue wall, there is a reflection of myself.
An unmatched glow of excitement and anxiety shines in my eyes,
But i tremble, my confidence wavers and for just a split second I doubt myself.
I take one last look, and push off onto the wave.
Speeding down the glassy face a grin breaks onto my face,
I have not a care in the world!
Wind whips at my face, but I am unstoppable the wind can’t slow me down.
The world around me slowly slips away, and the initial adrenaline is lost.
All that is left is myself, and the wave closing around me.
Looking through the tube
I find myself in the mind of the ocean, an aspiring glass blower,
Carefully shaping the perfect tube, with just the right blend of colors.
The brilliance of distorted oranges and reds of the sun streak across the foaming lip,
and the most beautiful teal blue encapsulates me!
The wave closes out.
Dark sands infect the face of the wave,
and sinister blues overtake the once jubilant hues.
I take my last breath,
and slip into the darkness...
